question_text: what actions items should we make sure to mention from last weeks call
answer_text: Which company are you asking about? Please mention the company name so I can find the right meeting.

**Customer Themes Across 18 Calls:**

1. **Pilot Testing and Validation** (mentioned in 3/18 calls)
   - Several meetings discuss the process of identifying pilot stores and validating setups, indicating a focus on testing new systems or processes before full implementation.
   - Representative quote: "Corey will follow up with you and we can get working with you on identifying the right pilot store and doing some validation." — Corey Chang

2. **System and Dashboard Effectiveness** (mentioned in 2/18 calls)
   - Customers are evaluating the effectiveness of new systems and dashboards, with positive feedback on certain tools being superior to others.
   - Representative quote: "They've been testing out some other stuff, but when we gave them a demo, they said that Picker is just head and shoulders above everything else that they've they've been testing out." — Calum McClelland

3. **Accuracy and Monitoring** (mentioned in 2/18 calls)
   - There is a focus on the accuracy of systems, particularly in monitoring start and end events, with high accuracy rates being reported.
   - Representative quote: "We actually automatically monitor all of the accuracy of this and our start and end start and end um events are over 99.4% accurate on the last run." — Hannah White

4. **Service Efficiency Adjustments** (mentioned in 1/18 calls)
   - Discussions include making adjustments to service processes to improve efficiency, such as addressing delays by service advisors.
   - Representative quote: "it's allowing us to make adjustments and adjust where needed like uh you know service advisors taking too long while gre..." — Eric H

5. **Customer Engagement and Relationship Building** (mentioned in 1/18 calls)
   - Building relationships with customers and engaging in meaningful conversations is highlighted as part of the customer interaction strategy.
   - Representative quote: "Great. I'll give you a little background on our relationship with ACE. So, we we met R.J. and Phil and the team uh end of last year. Uh had some really good conversations." — Ryan Chacon

These themes highlight the focus on testing and validating new systems, ensuring accuracy, improving service efficiency, and maintaining strong customer relationships.

question_text: how can we improve the monitoring of the system, cameras go down, task go offline, models perform different in locations?
answer_text:
To improve the monitoring of PitCrew's system, including cameras going down, tasks going offline, and varying model performance across locations, consider implementing the following strategies:

1. **Proactive System Health Monitoring**:
   - Implement a centralized dashboard that monitors the health of cameras and system components in real-time. This way, you can quickly identify issues with cameras going offline or tasks failing and receive alerts to address them swiftly.

2. **Automated Alerts and Notifications**:
   - Utilize SMS and email notifications feature for real-time updates. Set up alerts for any camera or system component failures, ensuring immediate action can be taken before it impacts operations.

3. **Data Consistency and Quality Checks**:
   - Regularly perform checks on the data being fed into the system to ensure consistency and reliability. This includes checking for anomalies in video feeds or discrepancies in captured data.

4. **Model Performance Evaluation**:
   - Implement periodic evaluations of the AI models' performance across different locations. This involves assessing model outcomes and accuracy in identifying vehicle analytics, ensuring they perform optimally in diverse environmental and operational conditions.

5. **Redundancy and Backup Systems**:
   - Consider setting up redundant systems or backup cameras in crucial operational areas. This ensures that if one camera or system component fails, another can seamlessly take over, minimizing any potential downtime or data loss.

6. **Continual Training & Updates**:
   - Keep the AI models and systems updated with the latest software revisions and enhancements. This practice helps maintain the system’s effectiveness and adaptivity to changing vehicle models or new types of automotive services.

7. **Feedback Loop for Continuous Improvement**:
   - Maintain a feedback system where operators and managers can easily report any perceived inconsistencies or issues with the system. Use these insights to continually improve the system’s performance and reliability.

These strategies can help ensure that PitCrew's monitoring and analytical capabilities are robust, reliable, and provide consistent value across all locations. If you need a customized solution or further assistance, collaboration with the product and technical team would be beneficial to address specific technical challenges or deployment concerns.

question_text: what was last call with jiffy about
answer_text:
*Meeting Summary (Allied Lube (Jiffy Lube))*

*Purpose*
• Align on scope, success criteria, and logistics for a 60‑day free pilot of Pit Crew (AI video analytics) and address camera/VMS access questions.

*Key Topics*
• Pilot plan: 4 phases (install/tuning; ~15‑day data baseline; days 15–60 live use with TV dashboards; final accuracy/impact report).  
• Technical setup: connect to existing NVR/DVR/VMS (incl. Specco), validate camera angles, confirm store bandwidth, ship and install server.  
• Roles/access: Bob as main point of contact; access for owner Richard, DMs, VP Ops, and store managers.  
• Success metrics: model accuracy (~99%), increased on‑target services/day, reduced service time and bay idle time; broader org impacts (throughput, manager enablement, customer experience, safety/loss prevention, staffing/capacity).  
• Client priorities: safety/compliance monitoring (PPE/uniform, smoking/vaping, fighting), theft detection, POS reconciliation, vehicle counts, door open/close times; weekly insight reviews.

*Decisions & Outcomes*
• Bob confirmed as primary POC.  
• 60‑day pilot will begin after installation/tuning; weekly check‑ins and a final report at end.  
• Corey to coordinate store selection and technical validation; TVs to be installed for live bay dashboards.  
• Leadership and store teams to receive system access.

*Open Questions*
• Which store to use for the pilot (Indiana vs. Georgia) and final camera/NVR credentials?  
• Confirm Pit Crew connectivity with Specco VMS at Indiana and any required bandwidth/IT specs.  
• Scope and configuration for safety/behavior detections (smoking/vaping, PPE/uniform, fighting) and theft alerts.  
• POS integration and methodology for car‑count vs. ticket reconciliation.  
• Timeline for shipping/installation of the server and TV dashboards.

question_text: help draft a follow up for Corey to coordinate store selection and technical validation; TVs to be installed for live bay dashboards.
answer_text:
Subject: Coordination for Store Selection and Technical Validation

Hi Corey,

I hope this message finds you well. Following our recent meeting regarding the 60-day pilot of PitCrew's AI video analytics, I'd like to coordinate the next steps for store selection and technical validation.

**Action Items:**
- **Store Selection:** We need to finalize which store (Indiana or Georgia) will be used for the pilot. Please let me know which location you believe would be the most suitable for this initiative.
  
- **Technical Validation:** Could you assist in confirming the connectivity with Specco VMS at the Indiana location? We aim to ensure all necessary bandwidth and IT specifications are met.

- **TV Installation:** Coordinating the installation of TVs for live bay dashboards is essential to our plan. Please advise on the logistics for this setup.

Your expertise and input will be invaluable in moving forward smoothly. Let me know a convenient time for you to discuss these items or if there is anything specific I can assist you with.

Thank you for your attention to these details.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
[Your Position]
PitCrew

Feel free to adjust any specific details to better fit your communication style or add any additional information you think is necessary.

Would you like me to look at:

- **All customers** - patterns across everyone
- **A specific customer** - just mention their name

For example: "...across all customers" or "...for Costco"
